Fireworks Spectaculour At Mandarin Oriental, Macau
Mandarin Oriental, Macau is the best place to watch the dazzling 27th Macau International Fireworks Display Contest in September and October. By booking the Fireworks Celebration accommodation package, guests can watch the spectacle through their room’s floor-to-ceiling windows and delight in Chef Dominique Bugnand’s French cuisine at the hotel’s signature Vida Rica Restaurant. Non-resident guests can watch the fireworks from Vida Rica Restaurant and Vida Rica Bar, with both offering celebratory menus for the event.
The Fireworks Celebration package is available on 5, 12, 19, 27 September and 1 October 2015, with rates starting from MOP 3,888 per night, and includes:
One night’s accommodation in a luxurious guestroom or suite with views of the fireworks display through floor-to-ceiling windows Four-course fireworks degustation dinner at Vida Rica Restaurant for two Package rates are subject to 10% service charge and 5% government tax. Three days’ advance reservation is required, and offer is subject to availability.
In addition, food connoisseurs can indulge in a Fireworks Degustation dinner menu at Vida Rica Restaurant from 1 September to 1 October 2015. Exquisitely presented dishes include Avocado Cannelloni with Seasonal Vegetables and Sturia Caviar; Boston Lobster and Girolle Mushrooms; and, for dessert, Peach and Lemon Thyme with Explosive Sugar Candy. The menu is priced at MOP 958 for four courses and MOP 1,288 for six courses.
Vida Rica Bar’s double height, floor-to-ceiling windows make it the perfect vantage point for marvelling at the magnificent fireworks displays. Guests can take delight in the variety of international delicacies on offer in The Fireworks Celebration Buffet, which includes an oyster and seafood bar, Portuguese cold cuts, roasted leg of lamb and other dishes served at a live carving station, Wagyu beef and a delectable selection of desserts. The buffet is served between 7:30pm and 10pm on 5, 12, 19, 27 September and 1 October 2015, and is priced at MOP 488 per person. As an extra indulgence, guests can enjoy a two-hour beverage package at an additional charge.
Source:- Mandarin Oriental
